titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I received the Holy Communion in the chapel at Bishopthorpe. Then I went to Convocation, & took part in a futile debate on the rubric about the Athanasian Creed. Frere took his seat as a proctor for the clergy. The Archbishop read his decision that, though unbeneficed, he was eligible. I lunched at the Deanery, but the aged Dean did not appear. I came back to Durham by the 4.55 p.m. train.
